primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God reveals His transcendent majesty to Job, moving him from a state of ignorant protest to a state of comforted humility and faith.

subject.identificatie: God (The Living God/The Voice out of the Whirlwind)
tekstueel_bewijs: God appears out of a whirlwind and addresses Job directly.
God grants him a personal audience.
God reveals himself as the One who was already present.
Job’s great longing is for revelation.
their inner understanding has been opened — by God.
He craves a God who is really God.
God is the author of creation; the creation is not the author of God.

ontvanger.identificatie: Job (and by extension the suffering city of New Orleans)
tekstueel_bewijs: the words from the book of Job may become the Word of God this morning for Trinity Church.
I have prayed all last week that the Holy Spirit will be the interpreter.
Through the Word of God the Holy Spirit creates such faith.

tegenstander.identificatie: Human Wisdom/Sin and Death/The need for 'Explanations'
tekstueel_bewijs: Job’s friends... and their pious platitudes.
we are subject to Sin and Death.
their need to believe that there are 'explanations' for everything.
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just bad advice, but the ontological limitation of 'flesh and blood' and the cosmic powers of Sin and Death.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The hearer's response of faith and silence following the encounter with God.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer/Job
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (human response) is a direct consequence of the primary program (God's self-revelation).

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.subject_naar_object: God → Opening the eyes of the blind

voorbeelden_god_subject: God appears out of a whirlwind.
God grants him a personal audience.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: Job simply sets aside all his great sufferings.
We human beings begin and end in dust.

voorbeelden: We need to get one problem out of the way.
Job’s great longing is for revelation.
He craves a God who is really God.
I have uttered what I did not understand.
things... which I did not know.
Only God can do such a thing.
Flesh and blood cannot inherit the kingdom of God.
Salvation must come from somewhere else.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on human 'non-pouvoir' (inability) contrasted with God's absolute 'pouvoir' (power to save and reveal).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from S2 (suffering/dust) through ~S1 (empty words of friends) to S1 (God's voice), ending in ~S2 (comforted dust).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved not by explaining suffering, but by the presence of the Creator which makes the suffering 'melt away'.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Very high; the sermon acknowledges the 'abysmal despair' and the 'suffering city'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. God is the primary actor, and human transformation is a passive result of God's self-disclosure.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Job is presented as a model of silence.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: Only God can do such a thing.
Flesh and blood cannot inherit the kingdom of God.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Job is not an example to follow but a recipient of a divine act.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides a theocentric reading: God reveals Himself to Job/Thomas.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief from the burden of needing to understand or fix their own suffering.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic revelation; faith is a gift created by the Word.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The narrative of Job is perfectly integrated with the Easter message of Resurrection.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: we are baptized into Christ’s death, so that we may be raised by him.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit creates the faith (Pouvoir) that the hearer lacks.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is linked with Death as a power that 'flesh and blood' cannot overcome.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God as the Subject of the primary narrative program.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: The lack of 'Devoir' is appropriate for an Easter/Comfort sermon.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (God reveals) correctly precedes Ethics (Job is quiet).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in theocentric preaching that avoids the trap of moralizing Job's patience.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis might focus on the 'dust' metaphor, Greimas shows that 'dust' is the state of the Receiver waiting for the Subject's action.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains Job's Hebrew; Greimas explains how the sermon's 'engine' moves the hearer from despair to comfort.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'comfort' Job feels is not psychological but actantial—he is moved from being a failed Subject (trying to understand) to a successful Receiver.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'seeing' metaphor to bridge the gap between God's action and human perception.
